messages.message: @hannah would you mind connecting with @Ed on this thread.  It brings up a couple new gaps in expectations for Enterprise clients.  This feedback is outside the UI, and related to admins being able to access data.  We should consider this as we move forward in our role/persona definitions.
I just realized I made a typo in my last message- it should read "Anything you add to that workspace _won't_ show up for other org members."
For single tenant environments we disable community context
I don't think this is an issue for our enterprise accounts - it's only applicable for MT where you can have a community account (your own) and be part of an org (similar to Github)

the issue is org admins having access to ALL data within the organization - that is an anti-pattern and an issue for enterprise security teams:
```Organization members can't access each other's personal workspace, except for admins, who can access all organization workspaces.```
org admins need elevated permissions to administer the environment, but that should be separated from data plane access.
Got it - can you create new feature request for it? Understood this is a request for the future, but unlikely to be a priority given our limited resources
